New Records: The Dodgers set a historic first with three leadoff home runs in the same game
Shohei Ohtani, Mookie Betts, and Freddie Freeman each hit home runs in the first three at-bats
The Dodgers secured a win despite challenges from the Diamondbacks
The victory helped the Dodgers maintain their lead in the National League West
Key Match Events: Leadoff home runs by Ohtani, Betts, and Freeman
Diamondbacks scored four runs in the first inning with defensive miscues
Diamondbacks tied the game in the third inning
Dodgers won in the ninth inning with a two-run single by Tommy Edman
Evan Phillips pitched a scoreless ninth inning in his MLB debut
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts highlighted the team's grit and fight
Miguel Rojas emphasized the importance of tight-game preparation
Evan Phillips reflected on the bullpen's resilience and the team's competitive spirit
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' bullpen was tested with only three relievers available
The game's outcome was significant in the divisional race
The victory marked a pivotal moment for the Dodgers' playoff push
Others: The Dodgers traded Gavin Lux to the Cincinnati Reds
Hyeseong Kim was noted as a future addition to the team
